original_solution_mapping.L1: You first have to calculate the total mass of apples he had on the shelves, so you add the three kinds of apples: 23 kg + 37 kg + 14 kg = <<23+37+14=74>>74kg
original_solution_mapping.L2: Since he sold 36 kg of apples, he still has: 74 kg - 36 kg = <<74-36=38>>38kg

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4111.
    Returns: the mass of apples that Ali has left.
    """
    # L1
    kidney_apples_kg = 23 # 23 kg of kidney apples
    golden_apples_kg = 37 # 37 kg of golden apples
    canada_apples_kg = 14 # 14 kg of Canada apples
    total_initial_apples_kg = kidney_apples_kg + golden_apples_kg + canada_apples_kg

    # L2
    sold_apples_kg = 36 # 36 kg of apples were sold
    remaining_apples_kg = total_initial_apples_kg - sold_apples_kg

    # FA
    answer = remaining_apples_kg
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: You first have to calculate the total mass of apples he had on the shelves, so you add the three kinds of apples: {kidney_apples_kg} kg + {golden_apples_kg} kg + {canada_apples_kg} kg = <<{kidney_apples_kg}+{golden_apples_kg}+{canada_apples_kg}={total_initial_apples_kg}>>{total_initial_apples_kg}kg

Since he sold {sold_apples_kg} kg of apples, he still has: {total_initial_apples_kg} kg - {sold_apples_kg} kg = <<{total_initial_apples_kg}-{sold_apples_kg}={remaining_apples_kg}>>{remaining_apples_kg}kg

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: You first have to calculate the total mass of apples he had on the shelves, so you add the three kinds of apples: 23 kg + 37 kg + 14 kg = <<23+37+14=74>>74kg
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Since he sold 14 kg of apples, he still has: 74 kg - 14 kg = <<74-14=60>>60kg

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'canada_apples_kg' (14) was used instead of 'sold_apples_kg' (36).
